Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; top of lotus flower in added white outline on left and trace of another on right; between, most of rosette in white outline with added red centres; below, two white bands; exterior: around rim, row of short diagonal strokes between pairs of dilute lines; below, part of rosette and pendant horseshoe roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 263, no. 542)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0468) (phase 2)
